webwork-tex.statement:
%mbx script removed problem header Let \(\ f(x) = 36 - x^2\). \par a) Compute each of the following expressions and interpret each as an average rate of change: \par (i) \(\ \ \ \frac{f( 4 ) - f(0)}{ 4 - 0} = \ \) \mbox{\parbox[t]{10ex}{\hrulefill}} \par (ii) \(\ \ \frac{f( 6 ) - f( 4 )}{6 - 4 } = \ \) \mbox{\parbox[t]{10ex}{\hrulefill}} \par (iii) \(\ \frac{f( 6 ) - f(0)}{6 - 0} = \ \) \mbox{\parbox[t]{10ex}{\hrulefill}} \par b) Based on the graph sketched below, match each of your answers in (i) - (iii) with one of the lines labeled A - F. Type the corresponding letter of the line segment next to the appropriate formula. Clearly not all letters will be used. \par \begin{center} \includegraphics[width=0.6\linewidth]{webwork-tex/webwork-3-image-1.png}
\leavevmode\\\relax (click on image to enlarge) \par
\par\smallskip\begin{center}\begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline
\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}} & \(\frac{f( 4 ) - f(0)}{ 4 - 0}\) \\ \hline
\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}} & \(\frac{f( 6 ) - f( 4 )}{6 - 4 }\) \\ \hline
\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}} &\(\frac{f( 6 ) - f(0)}{6 - 0}\) \\ \hline
\end {tabular}\end{center}\par\smallskip
\end{center}
\par \par {\bf Solution: }\par {\bf SOLUTION } \par a) \leavevmode\\\relax i) \(\frac{f( 4 ) - f(0)}{ 4 - 0} = \frac{ 20 - 36 }{4 - 0} = \frac{ -16 }{ 4} = -4\) \par ii) \(\frac{f( 6 ) - f( 4 ) }{ 6 - 4 } = \frac{ 0 - 20}{6 - 4} = \frac{ -20 }{ 2} = -10\) \par iii) \(\frac{f( 6 ) - f(0)}{ 6 - 0} = \frac{ 0 - 36 }{ 6 - 0} = \frac{ -20 }{ 6} = -6\) \par b) The formulas in parts (i), (ii), and (iii) represent the average rate of change of \(f(x)\) over the intervals \(0 \leq x \leq 4\) , \(4 \leq x \leq 6\) , and \(0 \leq x \leq 6\) respectively. Thus line segment D connecting the points (0, 36 ) and ( 4, 20 ) illustrates formula (i), line segment C connecting the points ( 4, 20 ) and ( 6, 0 ) illustrates formula (ii), and line segment B connecting the points (0, 36 ) and ( 6, 0 ) illustrates formula (iii).
\par
